Issues.Title: WPF ClickOnce
Issues.Body: Would be great to be able to add Azure Key Vault details during certification with ClickOnce. Trend is that we no longer have private keys and pfx certificates, but on that note we have some applications published without devops solutions. In my case shared via shared drive :)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "WPF ClickOnce" (#8557)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "[main] Update dependencies from dotnet/winforms" (#8555)

Issues.Title: OSS Scrubbing
Issues.Body:
- [ ] Policheck
- [ ] Sanitization
- [ ] Code Formatting
- [ ] Licensing Headers
- [ ] Comments Scrubbing
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "OSS Scrubbing" (#8554)

Issues.Title: Theme Manager and Theme Switching
Issues.Body:
- [ ] The app's theme should change depending upon the system theme changed event.
- [ ] App developers should have a method to change the theme to light/dark.
- [ ] Theme manager should handle all the necessary actions corresponding to themes.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Theme Manager and Theme Switching" (#8553)

Issues.Title: Testing
Issues.Body:
- [ ] Each change should also have the necessary unit tests which will be run on the CI.
- [ ] Tests should cover all states of the controls. (Active, Hover, Selected etc)
- [ ] Test that the theme changes are happening correctly over different scenarios of system theme change and user theme change.
- [ ] Test that the themes are being loaded properly.
- [ ] Test that switching theme is not leading to inconsistencies.
- [ ] Test that the performance isn't getting degraded due to theme changes.
- [ ] Test 3rd party controls for proper working after theme changes
- [ ] Test all local wpf tests including DRTs, Microsuites and Feature Tests
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Testing" (#8552)

Issues.Title: Sample applications update
Issues.Body:
- [ ] Create new sample applications with updated themes
- [ ] Update sample applications on a separate branch to new themes in WPF-Samples
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Sample applications update" (#8551)

Issues.Title: Fallback /Opt-out mechanism
Issues.Body:
- [ ] Create a mechanism to opt out of the new theme changes
- [ ] The user should be able to opt out of the new Theme changes in case of issues.
- [ ] Opting out should take the user to the default state.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Fallback /Opt-out mechanism" (#8550)

Issues.Title: Compatibility Review and Testing
Issues.Body:
- [ ] Upgrade common applications to .NET9 and add check for proper look and feel of controls in the apps.
- [ ] Upgrade some big enterprise applications to .NET9 and check for proper look and feel of controls in the apps.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Compatibility Review and Testing" (#8549)

Issues.Title: Accessibility Review and Testing
Issues.Body:
- [ ] Check for A11y sanity using the A11y insights tools.
- [ ] Get the A11Y Test Pass Feature test run on the updated Styles.
- [ ] Fix A11y issues reported by the team
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Accessibility Review and Testing" (#8548)

Issues.Title: Branch, Build Setup, Review, Guidelines
Issues.Body:
- [ ] Setup a new branch for win11theming feature
- [ ] Setup the build pipeline on the feature branch
- [ ] Add setup to run relevant tests
- [ ] Set up code review guidelines
- [ ] Setup a process to get the changes inside.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Branch, Build Setup, Review, Guidelines" (#8547)

Issues.Title: Visual Studio Toolbox and Designer Integration
Issues.Body:
- [ ] Visual studio should be able to pick up the updated control styles
- [ ] New Control styles are shown properly in Visual Studio Designer
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Visual Studio Toolbox and Designer Integration" (#8546)

Issues.Title: Mica and Acrylic Support
Issues.Body:
- [ ] Win 11 theme in WPF should also support acrylic background, Mica styles for eg: Transparent glass like background
- [ ] App layering and card layout are some more detailed features of the mica material theme which should be supported to bring the same look and feel to WPF apps. 
- [ ] Measure the performance impact of the changes for Mica and Acrylic
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Mica and Acrylic Support" (#8545)

Issues.Title: Rounded Corners
Issues.Body:
- [ ] Prioritize controls where rounded corners add more visual value
- [ ] Write performance measurement benchmark for rounded corners.
- [ ] For container controls - Check performance impact.
- [ ] TypeConverters 
- [ ] CornerRadius Attribute


### Notes:

- CornerRadius Property and Converter already existing for wpf.
- For button and some other controls this property is not Present in the backing cs file. We might need to add this property to those controls. [API Change]
- We might not want to have CornerRadius property in all the xaml file with the same values to avoid duplication.
- We can have a list of variables, which contains the cornerradius values, and we can set CornerRadius property with this value as a DynamicResource.
- Performance needs to be assessed per control and multiple controls on the same window and for different categories of controls like container controls, nested controls.

### Open Questions:
- Clarify what happens when the Dev overrides the cornerRadius attribute in the app?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Rounded Corners" (#8544)

Issues.Title: Snap Layout
Issues.Body:
- [ ] Verify that snap layout is working for WPF applications
- [ ] Snap layout works fine with Window Chrome as well
- [ ] Custom Chrome Title Bar of WPF doesn't support snap layout features.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Snap Layout" (#8543)

Issues.Title: System Theme Interactions
Issues.Body:
- [ ] Listen to the System Theme Changed Events
- [ ] Apply Dark/Light themes to applications depending upon the system theme change.
- [ ] Give an option to the developer to not change the App theme based on System theme change.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "System Theme Interactions" (#8542)

Issues.Title: Theme Specific Styling
Issues.Body:
Create a theme specific resource dictionary which will be included in the app.xaml and will contain the following:

- [ ] Color Brushes
- [ ] Color Gradients
- [ ] Accent Color and Variations
- [ ] Fill Colors and Stroke Colors


Make sure that the combined RD of theme specific styling gets included in the app.xaml and is updated in templates also.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Theme Specific Styling" (#8541)

Issues.Title: Public API Changes
Issues.Body:
- [ ] ThemeService
- [ ] ApplicationThemeManager
- [ ] SystemThemeManager
- [ ] SystemThemeWatcher
- [ ] ApplicationTheme
- [ ] SystemTheme
- [ ] ThemeChangedEvent
- [ ] IThemeService
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Public API Changes" (#8540)

Issues.Title: Control Specific Styling
Issues.Body:
- [ ] Create style xamls for each wpf control
- [ ] Import the style from App.Xaml
- [ ] Add all the relevant API changes, also mark an entry to the [Public API changes page](https://github.com/orgs/dotnet/projects/147/views/1?pane=issue&itemId=45111058) for WPF Win 11 theming.
- [ ] Verify that the control is working fine and looking fine in all the states(Active, Hover, Selected etc)
- [ ] Create a combined RD of all the above xamls for each control
- [ ] Add the combined Controls RD to the app.xaml
- [ ] Verify that all the controls are working and looking as desired
- [ ] Create a mechanism to import the style in app.xaml by default from .NET9
- [ ] Modify the template projects for wpf to have win 11 theming styles

Issues.Title: Additional changes to define Value property of Setter as XAML content property
Issues.Body:
Fixes #84

Main PR #745 

## Description

This PR is required to make Setter as XAML content property work during xaml compilation. 

## Customer Impact

This will make `Value` the `ContentProperty` for Setter in order to make the code a bit less verbose.

## Regression

NA

## Testing

Internal testing done, no new failures encountered.

## Risk

This change will affect the xaml tree depth, will make changes in wpf test repo in order to ensure appropriate test coverage to accommodate this.

Issues.Title: Replace binary formatter
Issues.Body:
## Description

The Binary Formatter was initially developed prior to the comprehensive understanding of deserialization vulnerabilities as a significant threat.  As a result, the code doesn’t follow the modern practices. Due to the security vulnerability Binary formatter is considered obsolete. In .NET 9.0, the entire Binary formatter infrastructure will be removed from the product. 

Binary Reader and Writer can be used to read and write the primitive data types into binary data and does not have any security vulnerability. We are creating a safe handle ‘BinaryFormatWriter’ which handles all primitives, Enums, strings, arrays and lists of primitives, and other items before falling into the process of serialization/deserialization. For serialization/deserialization we will use Binary writer. This approach will allow us to disable Binary formatter for the primitive and some other cases. 
 To convert the object to binary data we call TryWriteFrameworkObject with a memory stream and the object.  
BinaryFormattedObject class is added to parse a binary formatted object from a stream. It used Binary reader to read from a stream.
This solution is similar as in WinForms
PR: https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9088
CC
@JeremyKuhne @lonitra 

![image](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/assets/107022063/f18c9730-7c61-4030-b3eb-4fb42b2cc3d0)


## Customer Impact
 In .NET 9.0, the entire Binary formatter infrastructure will be removed from the product, and it will become obsolete. 
It has additional benefits of making applications more friendly to linker trimming.



## Regression

N/A

## Testing

Internal testing done.

## Risk

Low
There might be a few instances where this solution won't be effective. Currently, this PR includes all the primitive types and few more data types. The plan is to handle additional cases as feedback comes in.

Issues.Title: Full ItemSource iteration on ExtendSelection
Issues.Body:
https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blame/4ae9e616402ba1128eb11fb075746ed9b2fd6269/src/Microsoft.DotNet.Wpf/src/PresentationFramework/System/Windows/Controls/DataGrid.cs#L4845

FullRow Extending Selection traverses all `ItemSources` from index 0 to `endIndex`, stacking the UI if the `ItemSource` contains a large number of items.

For example, there are more than 1,000,000 rows and the selection starts somewhere at the end of the datagrid. Colossal load on the ItemsSource. In my case, `ItemsSource` is a virtualised collection, so if an item was not in the collection, a request is sent to the database to load it. 

So I end up having to find a workaround, set `DataGrid.SelectionMode == Single`, and simulate `Extended` mode in my code.

Please, say, for what enumerator is here, and may it be fixed?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Full ItemSource iteration on ExtendSelection" (#8531)

Issues.Title: .net 8: Crash in ItemsControlAutomationPeer using recycling
Issues.Body:
### Description

 last line below: recyclableWrapper.**Peer**  is null

```
protected override string GetNameCore()
{
  AutomationPeer wrapperPeer = GetWrapperPeer();
  string text = null;
  object item = Item;
  if (wrapperPeer != null)
  {
    text = wrapperPeer.GetName();
  }
  else if (item != null)
  {
    ItemsControlAutomationPeer itemsControlAutomationPeer = ItemsControlAutomationPeer;
    if (itemsControlAutomationPeer != null)
    {
      using RecyclableWrapper recyclableWrapper = itemsControlAutomationPeer.GetRecyclableWrapperPeer(item);
      text = recyclableWrapper.Peer.GetName();
    }
  }
```

this issue looks similar:
 https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/pull/7115

### Reproduction Steps

Create an ItemsControl utilizing Groups with Recycling

  <Grid>
    <ItemsControl VirtualizingStackPanel.IsVirtualizing="True"
                  VirtualizingStackPanel.VirtualizationMode="Recycling"
                  VirtualizingStackPanel.IsVirtualizingWhenGrouping="True"
                  ItemsSource="{Binding GroupedItems}"
                  Template="{StaticResource TemplateListTemplate}">
      <ItemsControl.ItemsPanel>
        <ItemsPanelTemplate>
          <VirtualizingStackPanel />
        </ItemsPanelTemplate>
      </ItemsControl.ItemsPanel>
      <ItemsControl.ItemTemplate>
        <DataTemplate>
          <Expander Header="{Binding GroupName}">
            <ListBox ItemsSource="{Binding Items}">
              <ListBox.ItemTemplate>
                <DataTemplate>
                  <TextBlock Text="{Binding}" />
                </DataTemplate>
              </ListBox.ItemTemplate>
            </ListBox>
          </Expander>
        </DataTemplate>
      </ItemsControl.ItemTemplate>
    </ItemsControl>
  </Grid>

### Expected behavior

Need a null check

### Actual behavior

Debugger reports exception

### Regression?

_No response_

### Known Workarounds

_No response_

### Impact

_No response_

### Configuration

_No response_

_No response_
